data.name: Version
data.value: Version

data.name: This plugin was developed by John R. D'Orazio, a priest in the diocese of Rome.
data.value: This plugin was developed by John R. D'Orazio, a priest in the diocese of Rome.

data.name: It is a part of the BibleGet Project at {0}.
data.value: It is a part of the BibleGet Project at {0}.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: The author would like to thank Giovanni Gregori and Simone Urbinati for their code contributions.
data.value: The author would like to thank Giovanni Gregori and Simone Urbinati for their code contributions.

data.name: The BibleGet Project is an independent project born from the personal initiative of John R. D'Orazio, and is not funded by any kind of corporation.
data.value: The BibleGet Project is an independent project born from the personal initiative of John R. D'Orazio, and is not funded by any kind of corporation.

data.name: All of the expenses of the project server and domain, which amount to €200 a year, are accounted for personally by the author. All code contributions and development are entirely volunteered.
data.value: All of the expenses of the project server and domain, which amount to €200 a year, are accounted for personally by the author. All code contributions and development are entirely volunteered.

data.name: If you like the plugin and find it useful, please consider contributing even a small amount to help keep this project running. Even just €1 can make a difference. You can contribute using the appropriate menu item in this plugin's menu.
data.value: If you like the plugin and find it useful, please consider contributing even a small amount to help keep this project running. Even just €1 can make a difference. You can contribute using the appropriate menu item in this plugin's menu.

data.name: Help for BibleGet (Microsoft Office)

data.name: This Help dialog window introduces the user to the usage of the BibleGet I/O plugin for Microsoft Word.
data.value: This Help dialog window introduces the user to the usage of the BibleGet I/O plugin for Microsoft Word 2007+.

data.name: The Help is divided into three sections:
data.value: The Help is divided into three sections:

data.name: How to use the plugin
data.value: How to use the plugin

data.name: Description of the menu icons and their functionality.
data.value: Description of the menu icons and their functionality.

data.name: Once the extension is installed, a new menu 'BibleGet I/O' will appear on the menu bar. Also a new floating toolbar will appear. The buttons on the floating toolbar correspond to the menu items in the new menu, as can be seen in this image:
data.value: Once the extension is installed, a new menu 'BibleGet I/O' will appear on the menu bar. Also a new floating toolbar will appear. The buttons on the floating toolbar correspond to the menu items in the new menu, as can be seen in this image:

data.name: There are two ways of inserting a bible quote into a document.
data.value: There are two ways of inserting a bible quote into a document.

data.name: The first way is by using the input window.
data.value: The first way is by using the input window.

data.name: If you click on the menu item ''{0}'', an input window will open where you can input your query and choose the version or versions you would like to take the quote from.
data.value: If you click on the menu item ''{0}'', an input window will open where you can input your query and choose the version or versions you would like to take the quote from.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: This list of versions is updated from the available versions on the BibleGet server, but since the information is stored locally it may be necessary to renew the server information when new versions are added to the BibleGet server database.
data.value: This list of versions is updated from the available versions on the BibleGet server, but since the information is stored locally it may be necessary to renew the server information when new versions are added to the BibleGet server database.

data.name: In order to renew the information from the BibleGet server, click on the ''{0}'' menu item, and then click on the button ''{1}''.
data.value: In order to renew the information from the BibleGet server, click on the ''{0}'' menu item, and then click on the button ''{1}''.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: When you choose a version or multiple versions to quote from, this choice is automatically saved as a preference, and will be pre-selected the next time you open the ''{0}'' menu item.
data.value: When you choose a version or multiple versions to quote from, this choice is automatically saved as a preference, and will be pre-selected the next time you open the ''{0}'' menu item.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: The second way is by writing your desired quote directly in the document, and then selecting it and choosing the menu item ''{0}''. The selected text will be substituted by the Bible Quote retrieved from the BibleGet server.
data.value: The second way is by writing your desired quote directly in the document, and then selecting it and choosing the menu item ''{0}''. The selected text will be substituted by the Bible Quote retrieved from the BibleGet server.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: The versions previously selected in the ''{0}'' window will be used, so you must have selected your preferred versions at least once from the ''{0}'' window.
data.value: The versions previously selected in the ''{0}'' window will be used, so you must have selected your preferred versions at least once from the ''{0}'' window.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: Formatting preferences can be set using the 'Preferences' window. You can choose the desired font for the Bible quotes as well as the desired line-spacing, and you can choose separate formatting (font size, font color, font style) for the book / chapter, for the verse numbers, and for the verse text. Preferences are saved automatically.
data.value: Formatting preferences can be set using the 'Preferences' window. You can choose the desired font for the Bible quotes as well as the desired line-spacing, and you can choose separate formatting (font size, font color, font style) for the book / chapter, for the verse numbers, and for the verse text. Preferences are saved automatically.

data.name: After the 'Help' menu item that opens up this same help window, the last three menu items are:
data.value: After the 'Help' menu item that opens up this same help window, the last three menu items are:

data.name: Send feedback
data.value: Send feedback

data.name: This will open up your system's default email application with the bibleget.io@gmail.com feedback address already filled in.
data.value: This will open up your system's default email application with the bibleget.io@gmail.com feedback address already filled in.

data.name: Contribute
data.value: Make a contribution

data.name: This will open a Paypal page in the system's default browser where you can make a donation to contribute to the project. Even just €1 can help to cover the expenses of this project. Just the server costs €120 a year.
data.value: This will open a Paypal page in the system's default browser where you can make a donation to contribute to the project. Even just €1 can help to cover the expenses of this project. Just the server costs €120 a year.

data.name: Information on the BibleGet I/O Project
data.value: Information on the BibleGet I/O Project

data.name: This opens a dialog window with some information on the project and it's plugins, on the author and contributors, and on the current locally stored information about the versions and languages that the BibleGet server supports.
data.value: This opens a dialog window with some information on the project and it's plugins, on the author and contributors, and on the current locally stored information about the versions and languages that the BibleGet server supports.

data.name: How to formulate a bible query
data.value: How to formulate a bible query

data.name: The queries for bible quotes must be formulated using standard notation for bible citation.
data.value: The queries for bible quotes must be formulated using standard notation for bible citation.

data.name: This can be either the english notation (as explained here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bible_citation), or the european notation as explained here below.
data.value: This can be either the english notation (as explained here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bible_citation), or the european notation as explained here below.
data.comment: Fuzzy

data.name: A basic query consists of at least two elements: the bible book and the chapter.
data.value: A basic query consists of at least two elements: the bible book and the chapter.

data.name: The bible book can be written out in full, or in an abbreviated form.
data.value: The bible book can be written out in full, or in an abbreviated form.

data.name: The BibleGet engine recognizes the names of the books of the bible in {0} different languages: {1}
data.value: The BibleGet engine recognizes the names of the books of the bible in {0} different languages: {1}
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: See the list of valid books and abbreviations in the section {0}.
data.value: See the list of valid books and abbreviations in the section {0}.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: For example, the query "Matthew 1" means the book of Matthew (or better the gospel according to Matthew) at chapter 1.
data.value: For example, the query "Matthew 1" means the book of Matthew (or better the gospel according to Matthew) at chapter 1.

data.name: This can also be written as "Mt 1".
data.value: This can also be written as "Mt 1".

data.name: Different combinations of books, chapters, and verses can be formed using the comma delimiter and the dot delimiter (in european notation, in english notation instead a colon is used instead of a comma and a comma is used instead of a dot):
data.value: Different combinations of books, chapters, and verses can be formed using the comma delimiter and the dot delimiter (in european notation, in english notation instead a colon is used instead of a comma and a comma is used instead of a dot):

data.name: ",": the comma is the chapter-verse delimiter. "Matthew 1,5" means the book (gospel) of Matthew, chapter 1, verse 5. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5".)
data.value: ",": the comma is the chapter-verse delimiter. "Matthew 1,5" means the book (gospel) of Matthew, chapter 1, verse 5. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5".)

data.name: ".": the dot is a delimiter between verses. "Matthew 1,5.7" means the book (gospel) of Matthew, chapter 1, verses 5 and 7. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5,7".)
data.value: ".": the dot is a delimiter between verses. "Matthew 1,5.7" means the book (gospel) of Matthew, chapter 1, verses 5 and 7. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5,7".)

data.name: "-": the dash is a range delimiter, which can be used in a variety of ways:
data.value: "-": the dash is a range delimiter, which can be used in a variety of ways:

data.name: For a range of chapters: "Matthew 1-2" means the gospel according to Matthew, from chapter 1 to chapter 2.
data.value: For a range of chapters: "Matthew 1-2" means the gospel according to Matthew, from chapter 1 to chapter 2.

data.name: For a range of verses within the same chapter: "Matthew 1,1-5" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1, from verse 1 to verse 5. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:1-5".)
data.value: For a range of verses within the same chapter: "Matthew 1,1-5" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1, from verse 1 to verse 5. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:1-5".)

data.name: For a range of verses that span over different chapters: "Matthew 1,5-2,13" means the gospel according to Matthew, from chapter 1, verse 5 to chapter 2, verse 13. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5-2:13".)
data.value: For a range of verses that span over different chapters: "Matthew 1,5-2,13" means the gospel according to Matthew, from chapter 1, verse 5 to chapter 2, verse 13. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:5-2:13".)

data.name: Different combinations of these delimiters can form fairly complex queries, for example "Mt1,1-3.5.7-9" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1, verses 1 to 3, verse 5, and verses 7 to 9. (In English notation: "Mt1:1-3,5,7-9".)
data.value: Different combinations of these delimiters can form fairly complex queries, for example "Mt1,1-3.5.7-9" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1, verses 1 to 3, verse 5, and verses 7 to 9. (In English notation: "Mt1:1-3,5,7-9".)

data.name: Multiple queries can be combined together using a semi-colon ";".
data.value: Multiple queries can be combined together using a semi-colon ";".

data.name: If the query following the semi-colon refers to the same book as the preceding query, it is not necessary to indicate the book a second time.
data.value: If the query following the semi-colon refers to the same book as the preceding query, it is not necessary to indicate the book a second time.

data.name: For example, "Matthew 1,1;2,13" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1 verse 1 and chapter 2 verse 13. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:1;2:13".)
data.value: For example, "Matthew 1,1;2,13" means the gospel according to Matthew, chapter 1 verse 1 and chapter 2 verse 13. (In English notation: "Matthew 1:1;2:13".)

data.name: Here is an example of multiple complex queries combined into a single querystring: "Genesis 1,3-5.7.9-11.13;2,4-9.11-13;Apocalypse 3,10.12-14". (In English notation: "Genesis 1:3-5,7,9-11,13;2:4-9,11-13;Apocalypse 3:10,12-14").
data.value: Here is an example of multiple complex queries combined into a single querystring: "Genesis 1,3-5.7.9-11.13;2,4-9.11-13;Apocalypse 3,10.12-14". (In English notation: "Genesis 1:3-5,7,9-11,13;2:4-9,11-13;Apocalypse 3:10,12-14").

data.name: It doesn't matter whether or not you use a space between the book and the chapter, the querystring will be interpreted just the same.
data.value: It doesn't matter whether or not you use a space between the book and the chapter, the querystring will be interpreted just the same.

data.name: It is also indifferent whether you use uppercase or lowercase letters, the querystring will be interpreted just the same.
data.value: It is also indifferent whether you use uppercase or lowercase letters, the querystring will be interpreted just the same.

data.name: Here is a list of valid books and their corresponding abbreviations, either of which can be used in the querystrings.
data.value: Here is a list of valid books and their corresponding abbreviations, either of which can be used in the querystrings.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: The abbreviations do not always correspond with those proposed by the various editions of the Bible, because they would conflict with those proposed by other editions.
data.value: The abbreviations do not always correspond with those proposed by the various editions of the Bible, because they would conflict with those proposed by other editions.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: For example some english editions propose "Gn" as an abbreviation for "Genesis", while some italian editions propose "Gn" as an abbreviation for "Giona" (= "Jonah").
data.value: For example some english editions propose "Gn" as an abbreviation for "Genesis", while some italian editions propose "Gn" as an abbreviation for "Giona" (= "Jonah").
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: Therefore you will not always be able to use the abbreviations proposed by any single edition of the Bible, you must use the abbreviations that are recognized by the BibleGet engine as listed in the following table:
data.value: Therefore you will not always be able to use the abbreviations proposed by any single edition of the Bible, you must use the abbreviations that are recognized by the BibleGet engine as listed in the following table:
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: BOOK
data.value: BOOK
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: ABBREVIATION
data.value: ABBREVIATION
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: Instructions
data.value: Instructions

data.name: Help
data.value: Help

data.name: You cannot send an empty query.
data.value: You cannot send an empty query.

data.name: Mixed notations have been detected. Please use either english notation or european notation.
data.value: Mixed notations have been detected. Please use either english notation or european notation.

data.name: The first query <{0}> in the querystring <{1}> must start with a valid book indicator!
data.value: The first query <{0}> in the querystring <{1}> must start with a valid book indicator!
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: The book indicator <{0}> in the query <{1}> is not valid. Please check the documentation for a list of valid book indicators.
data.value: The book indicator <{0}> in the query <{1}> is not valid. Please check the documentation for a list of valid book indicators.
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: You must have a valid chapter following the book indicator!
data.value: You must have a valid chapter following the book indicator!

data.name: A query that doesn't start with a book indicator must however start with a valid chapter indicator!
data.value: A query that doesn't start with a book indicator must however start with a valid chapter indicator!

data.name: You cannot use a dot without first using a comma or a dash. A dot is a liason between verses, which are separated from the chapter by a comma.
data.value: You cannot use a dot without first using a comma or a dash. A dot is a liason between verses, which are separated from the chapter by a comma.

data.name: Verses concatenated by a dot must be consecutive, instead <{0}> is greater than or equal to <{1}> in the expression <{2}> in the query <{3}>
data.value: Verses concatenated by a dot must be consecutive, instead <{0}> is greater than or equal to <{1}> in the expression <{2}> in the query <{3}>
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: A dot must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.
data.value: A dot must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.

data.name: A comma must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.
data.value: A comma must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.

data.name: A chapter in the query is out of bounds: there is no chapter <{0}> in the book <{1}> in the requested version <{2}>, the last possible chapter is <{3}>
data.value: A chapter in the query is out of bounds: there is no chapter <{0}> in the book <{1}> in the requested version <{2}>, the last possible chapter is <{3}>
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: You cannot have more than one comma and not have a dash!
data.value: You cannot have more than one comma and not have a dash!

data.name: You seem to have a malformed querystring, there should be only one dash.
data.value: You seem to have a malformed querystring, there should be only one dash.

data.name: A verse in the query is out of bounds: there is no verse <{0}> in the book <{1}> at chapter <{2}> in the requested version <{3}>, the last possible verse is <{4}>
data.value: A verse in the query is out of bounds: there is no verse <{0}> in the book <{1}> at chapter <{2}> in the requested version <{3}>, the last possible verse is <{4}>
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: There are multiple dashes in the query, but there are not enough dots. There can only be one more dash than dots.
data.value: There are multiple dashes in the query, but there are not enough dots. There can only be one more dash than dots.

data.name: A dash must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.
data.value: A dash must be preceded and followed by 1 to 3 digits of which the first digit cannot be zero.

data.name: If there is a chapter-verse construct following a dash, there must also be a chapter-verse construct preceding the same dash.
data.value: If there is a chapter-verse construct following a dash, there must also be a chapter-verse construct preceding the same dash.

data.name: Chapters must be consecutive. Instead the first chapter indicator <{0}> is greater than or equal to the second chapter indicator <{1}> in the expression <{2}>
data.value: Chapters must be consecutive. Instead the first chapter indicator <{0}> is greater than or equal to the second chapter indicator <{1}> in the expression <{2}>
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name: Verses (or chapters if applicable) around the dash operator must be consecutive. Instead <{0}> is greater than or equal to <{1}> in the expression <{2}>
data.value: Verses (or chapters if applicable) around the dash operator must be consecutive. Instead <{0}> is greater than or equal to <{1}> in the expression <{2}>
data.comment: TRANSLATORS: This message is used by MessageFormat, make sure that translations double up any single quotes or apostrophes.

data.name:
Some Bible versions have their own formatting. This is left by default to keep the text as close as possible to the original.
If however you need to have consistent formatting in your document, you may override the Bible version's own formatting.
data.value: Some Bible versions have their own formatting. This is left by default to keep the text as close as possible to the original. If however you need to have consistent formatting in your document, you may override the Bible version's own formatting.
